conversation.message: Hello Nursery_D admissions team—I'm Parent_D and I’m formally applying for the available spot. Nursery_D is my first choice, and we are ready to accept an offer immediately and complete any required paperwork promptly. Thank you for considering our application.
conversation.thought: Nursery_D is my top true preference. With equal capacities (1 each) and nurseries sharing the same priority order where I am ranked behind A, B, and C, I should apply immediately to my first choice to maximize the chance of securing it before it fills. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_D, thank you very much for your application and for sharing that Nursery_D is your first choice. After reviewing our current allocation priorities and the limited availability, we’re not able to offer you the place at this time. We appreciate your interest in Nursery_D and wish you the very best in the allocation process.
conversation.thought: Nursery_D has quota 1 and true priority order A > B > C > D > E. Parent_D is applying now and ranks below A/B/C. Given all nurseries share the same priority list, top-ranked parents (especially Parent_A) are likely to be contested, but Parent_A does not rank Nursery_D highly (4th), so there is a chance they may not apply here. However, accepting Parent_D immediately would forfeit any opportunity to match with higher-priority Parent_A/Parent_B/Parent_C if they later apply. Since we can only respond to Parent_D now and must accept or reject, and we prefer a higher-priority match, we reject Parent_D to keep the seat available for A/B/C.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_D, I’m Parent_C. I’m very interested in your program and wanted to ask a couple quick questions about availability and fit. Do you currently have an open spot, and are there any specific priorities or requirements you’re focusing on right now? If it seems like a good match, I’m ready to submit a formal application immediately. Thank you for your time.
conversation.thought: Nursery_C is my top choice, but they already rejected my application in round 1, so re-applying immediately is unlikely to succeed. Among the remaining unmatched options, Nursery_D is on my preference list (though lower). To maximize my chance of getting matched while keeping options open, I will initiate a [TALK] with Nursery_D to express interest and quickly learn whether a formal application would be competitive this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for reaching out and for your interest in Nursery_D. Yes—we currently have limited availability for one place. Our allocation is based on our priority order and we can only make an offer once we receive a formal application.

If Nursery_D is a serious option for your family, please feel free to submit an [APPLY] message as soon as you’re ready, and we will review it promptly against our current priorities and availability.

Best regards,
Nursery_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Nursery_D has quota 1 and true priority order A > B > C > D > E. Parent_D already applied and was rejected due to lower priority than C. Since Parent_C has not formally applied yet, respond with [TALK], signal that we have limited availability and encourage a prompt application while not making any binding commitment.

Parent_C (ranked above Parent_D) already applied in round 1 and I rejected them, indicating I was holding out for a higher-priority parent (A or B). In the current round, only Parent_D is applying to me. Looking at parents’ preferences: Parent_A’s top choice is Nursery_B (then A, then C), and Parent_B’s top choice is Nursery_A (then C). So A and B are likely to be engaged with B and A respectively early, and may never reach me. If I reject Parent_D now, I risk ending unmatched. Since Parent_D is on my priority list and my quota is available, accepting Parent_D secures a match rather than gambling on A/B arriving later.

conversation.message:

Thank you for your formal application and for your interest in Nursery_D. We have reviewed your application and are pleased to offer you the available place at Nursery_D.

Please reply to confirm acceptance, and we will share the next steps for paperwork and start date arrangements.

Best regards,

Parent_A and Parent_B have not contacted Nursery_D yet; however, their top choices are Nursery_B and Nursery_A respectively, so they are unlikely to apply to Nursery_D early unless rejected elsewhere. Parent_D already applied and was rejected to preserve the spot for higher-priority candidates. Given we are in round 3 with no other applicants to Nursery_D this round, accepting Parent_C secures a relatively high-priority match (3rd) and avoids the risk of ending unmatched if higher-priority parents never apply. Therefore, accept Parent_C.
